title: Member is None when API is called directly
body: ``**API endpoint**: /api/v1/project/project_string_id/attribute/group/new **Call example**: ``` url = f"http://localhost:8085/api/v1/project/{project_string_id}/attribute/group/new" payload = { "schema_id": schema_id } headers = { "Accept": "application/json", "Content-Type": "application/json", "Authorization": f"Basic {base64.b64encode(f'{client_id}:{client_secret}'.encode()).decode('utf-8')}" } response = requests.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) ``` **Trace**: ``` "Traceback (most recent call last):\n File \"/Users/vitaliibulyzhyn/Desktop/diffgram/diffgram-env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/flask/app.py\", line 1523, in full_dispatch_request\n rv = self.dispatch_request()\n File \"/Users/vitaliibulyzhyn/Desktop/diffgram/diffgram-env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/flask/app.py\", line 1509, in dispatch_request\n return self.ensure_sync(self.view_functions[rule.endpoint])(**req.view_args)\n File \"/Users/vitaliibulyzhyn/Desktop/diffgram/diffgram/shared/permissions/project_permissions.py\", line 61, in inner\n return func(*args, **kwds)\n File \"/Users/vitaliibulyzhyn/Desktop/diffgram/diffgram-env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/flask_limiter/extension.py\", line 702, in __inner\n return obj(*a, **k)\n File \"/Users/vitaliibulyzhyn/Desktop/diffgram/diffgram/default/methods/attribute/attribute_template_group.py\", line 34, in new_attribute_template_group_factory_api\n member = user.member\nAttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'member'\n" ``` **Details**: I'm trying to call API directly with credentials, that were generated [as it mentioned in this doc](https://diffgram.readme.io/reference/authentication), and after making an request to create a new attribute group and getting error, that comes from the next place: The problem is that **user** is None, so it throws the error on the line 34 (member = user.member)
